Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Mueller terminated the emails and all communication between Strzok and Page, without providing any evidence to support this assertion.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to substantiate the accusation that Mueller illegally deleted the text messages.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Mueller terminated the emails and text messages without any basis or evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence of Mueller illegally deleting the text messages.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by making unsupported accusations and assumptions.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the absence of the text messages.
